articles.content:
Japan Urged to Return Remains of Korean Draftees 
    Tokyo, March 12 (KNS-KCNA) -- Representatives of the Saitama Prefectural group for probe into the truth behind the forcible drafting of Koreans and the Saitama Prefectural Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan  (Chongryon) visited the Cabinet Office, the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Japan on March 9 and strongly demanded Japan send the remains of Korean draftees buried in Tokorozawa City, Saitama Prefecture, to their home towns as soon as possible.
 Referring to the background against which their remains were buried there, the visitors noted with indignation that those remains have not yet been returned to their home towns though they have not been taken care of for 60 years since the liberation of Korea.    
 They urged the Japanese government to take a sincere measure for the settlement of this matter.

articles.content:
Congratulations to Greek President
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on March 13 sent a congratulatory
message to Carlos Papoulias upon his inauguration as Greek president.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the DPRK and the Republic of Greece would grow in scope and develop in conformity with the desire and interests of the two peoples, the message sincerely wished him good health and happiness and success in his responsible work for the prosperity and development of the country.
